questions.question: Why may a confined space be dangerous to work in?

options.A: There may not be sufficient working space
options.B: Air in the space may be unbreathable due to poisonous gas
options.C: Temperature and poor ventilation may affect the worker

questions.explanation: There can be a range of hazards associated with confined spaces, and these can include all of those mentioned.

questions.question: What must be considered first when planning to carry out work in a confined space?

options.A: Has the job been priced properly
options.B: Have the correct tools been arranged
options.D: Can the work be done from the outside

questions.explanation: Working outside will remove the risks of working in the confined space.

questions.question: When working in a confined space, such as a sewer, what danger may occur?

options.C: Not enough time for the job to be done

questions.explanation: Sewer gases can be inflammable and suffocating.

questions.question: To determine the safety of the atmosphere in an excavation, which of the following is essential.

options.C: Only entering for a short period to enable a quick escape

questions.explanation: Use a suitable detector. Many dangerous gases have no smell and cannot be seen. Workers can be overcome in seconds in dangerous atmospheres.

questions.question: Before entering an excavation to start work, it must first be:
questions.explanation: Excavation work is hazardous. A competent person, knowledgeable about how to reduce risks, notably from collapse of the walls, must inspect the excavation first.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a permit to work system?

options.A: To ensure the job is carried out by the quickest method
options.B: To help ensure a safe system of work
options.C: To ensure that the client will pay for the work
options.D: To enable tools and equipment to be properly checked before the commencement of work

questions.explanation: A permit to work is a written system used to control certain types of hazardous work. They allow work to start only when site procedures have been clarified.

questions.question: Why may young people be more at risk on site?

options.A: There is no specific legislation applying to them
options.B: They are usually left to work alone to gain experience
options.C: There is no requirement to provide PPE to young people
options.D: They are inexperienced and may not recognise danger

questions.explanation: Health and Safety guidance lists young people as often being at particular risk , due to their lack of practical experience.

questions.question: You have to enter a manhole in which you know there are toxic gases. You have all the PPE but there does not appear to be a rescue plan in place. What should you do?

options.A: Just get on and do the job, it will probably be alright
options.B: Plan to carry out the job in short bursts
options.C: Do not enter the manhole until a rescue plan and rescue equipment are in place
options.D: Ask your mate to stand-by at the top of the manhole with a length of rope

questions.explanation: A rescue plan must be in place before anyone enters a confined space. This is one of the requirements of the Confined Spaces Regulations 1997.

questions.question: You have to enter a manhole in which you believe there could be toxic gases. You have not been provided with any Respiratory Protective Equipment (RPE). What should you do?

options.A: Tell your supervisor that you will need RPE, and if necessary, training in confined space working
options.B: Sniff the atmosphere in the manhole to see if you can smell harmful gases
options.C: Look into the manhole to see if you can see any harmful gases
options.D: Just get on with the job, and accept the risks

questions.explanation: An employer must provide all necessary personal protective equipment and respiratory protective equipment when an employee is required to enter a confined space. This is one of the requirements of the Confined Spaces Regulations 1997.

questions.question: While digging a trench, you uncover a length of yellow marker tape at a depth of about 150mm. What does the presence of the marker tape mean?

options.A: The area has a high water-table and precautions must be taken to prevent an in-rush of water
options.B: There is a buried electrical cable and further excavation must be carried out with care
options.C: There is contaminated soil below the level of the marker tape and all excavation must stop
options.D: The excavation has reached a depth where the sides must now be supported

questions.explanation: The coloured tape indicates that there are buried services below the route of the tape.

questions.question: A Cable Avoidance Tool (C.A.T.) and a Genny (generator) can be used successfully to locate underground cables by whom:
questions.explanation: Equipment used to locate buried services must only be used by people who have been trained to use it.

questions.question: When exposing underground power cables, which method of excavation should you use?

options.A: A 360 degree excavator with rubber tyres

questions.explanation: Hand-held power tools and mechanical excavators should not be used too close to underground services and hand digging should be carried out with care.

questions.question: When do special precautions need to be taken when working near overhead electric power lines?

options.A: Only if cranes etc. are being used
options.B: Only if someone could touch a line with their bare hands
options.C: Only if plant has to pass under the lines
options.D: Whenever work areas will be near or beneath the lines

questions.explanation: Actual contact with a power line is not necessary to result in an electric shock as a close approach may allow flashover to occur. HSE publication GS6 gives advice on procedures to avoid such danger.

questions.question: When working alone:

options.A: Make sure someone responsible knows where you are
options.B: You can do away with protective equipment
options.C: Don't bother anyone if you have a problem, always sort it out yourself
options.D: Wear headphones, it will make the day go more quickly

questions.explanation: Employees should adhere to safe working arrangements put in place by their employer. When working alone, such arrangements should include informing a responsible person of your location periodically.

questions.question: You have to walk across a site several times a day, but have to dodge a lot of site traffic. The first thing you should do is:

options.B: Walk around the edges of the site to keep out of the way
options.C: Tell your supervisor about the danger
options.D: Jump on the back of a vehicle if you can, it's safer than walking

questions.explanation: Pedestrian routes should have been set up to keep people and vehicles apart, so inform your employer if the system is not working. Don't hitch rides on vehicles unless safe seating is provided.

questions.question: A mobile plant operator can let you ride in the machine:

options.A: If you have a long way to go
options.C: If it is designed to carry passengers

questions.explanation: Don't hitch rides on vehicles unless safe seating is provided.
